text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^{8}\rightarrow \mathbb R^{11}[/mathjaxinline] be a linear transformation with standard matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline]. If there are six pivots when [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is row-reduced, what is the nullity of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: We showed in the video that the nullity of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] equals the number of free variables in [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline]. [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] has eight columns, and six pivots when row reduce, so there must be [mathjaxinline]8-6[/mathjaxinline], or 2, free variables.
